Tavatron:

Tavatron whimpered softly as she drifted in and out of sleep. A mirage of 
images danced across the inside of her optics. They were shrouded in a gray 
fog of mystery and harsh reality. Maximals, Predacons, a valley not unlike 
the one she and Dinobot had practiced in, all fleeting dreams of a past that 
was not her own. Tavatron groaned and whimpered... a fire.

Tavatron stared through optics that were not her own at a world she had 
never known. Suddenly a blackening fog engulfed the images and they were no 
more. Tavatron cried out silently in her sleep as reality hit her like a ton 
of bricks.

Dinobot, the resent battle with the Predacons, slowly the images faded from 
her mind as they were replaced with those of the present. She shut her 
optics tightly, concern and worry etched on her sleeping face. She silently 
cried, the tears flowing freely inside. She was too tired to return to beast 
mode, and unable to cry in robot mode. The sorrow and concern engulfed her, 
shaking her to the very core of her spark.

Thoughts of her lost friend filled her mind, then those of Dinobot's near 
death. A slow realization dawned on her. She was afraid. Afraid to be alone. 
Dinobot had replaced the void her friend's death had created all those 
stellercycles ago. She didn't want to lose him, not now. Tavatron fell limp 
against the side of the 'R chamber, her arms wrapped about her knees in a 
desperate atempt to hold on to reality.

Suddenly a sense of calm filled her, something she had never felt before. 
Tavatron relaxed as she fell into a deep, somewhat peaceful slumber.
